rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment uses neutral language without high-potency verbs, potent metaphors, superlatives, or critical alert phrases.
The segment uses hypothetical language ('may have infected') and a plain outcome verb ('developed symptoms'), excluded by Q3 rules.
Segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
The segment reports patient may have infected contacts but contains no explicit calming language.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
Segment describes a finding/event, not capability or preparedness.
Reports number of people potentially infected ('one household member and six health care workers', 'all of whom developed symptoms') using standard verbs.
